category_description: A general physicians is trained to provide healthcare to patients of any sex or age. General physicians often work as primary care physicians.
Dentists are the frontline of good oral health.
Gynecologists provide preventive care and disease management for female health conditions.
Pediatricians focus on treating children from birth to young adulthood. They may be a childâ€™s primary care physician and have training
Cardiologists focus on the cardiovascular system, which includes the heart and blood vessels. They treat many cardiovascular conditions
Neurologists are physicians specialized in the treatment of disorders of the nervous system.
Physiotherapists help people affected by injury, illness or disability through movement and exercise, manual therapy, education and advice.
A psychiatrist is a doctor who treats mental health conditions. They may use counseling, medication, or hospitalization as part of their treatment.
Dermatologists focus on diseases and conditions of the skin, nails, and hair. They treat conditions such as eczema, skin cancer, acne, and psoriasis.
A radiologist specializes in diagnosing and treating conditions using medical imaging tests.
A nephrologist focuses on kidney care and conditions that affect the kidneys. Conditions they can treat include: kidney ,disease,renal (kidney) failure,diabetes,kidney stones,lupus,hypertension.
Endocrinologists treat disorders and conditions that affect the endocrine system. This system involves various glands that make and release hormones in the body.
